values.description:
Compilation has been failing on jenkins homebrew, e.g. [this one](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/137/), which uses newer version of ffmpeg / libavcodec

- Replaced [AVPicture](https://ffmpeg.org/doxygen/3.0/group__lavc__picture.html) with AVFrame as the it is deprecated and some of its functions have been removed

- added checks for [LIBAVCODEC_VERSION_INT](https://www.ffmpeg.org/doxygen/3.0/libavcodec_2version_8h.html) to use new api for deleting AVPacket

jenkins:

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/141/) - one warning which should be fixed in fb7a95d

[abi-checker](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/API_ABI%20checker/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-vivid-amd64/137/) - ok
values.title: Fix gazebo compilation with ffmpeg3 / libavcodec

values.description:
We need to set the field of view of each camera for the OculusCamera, otherwise the view looks zoomed in.

You can see a live demo of this on the demo machine in our front lobby.
values.title: Fix oculus 2 camera field of view

summary.raw:
We need to set the field of view of each camera for the OculusCamera, otherwise the view looks zoomed in.

You can see a live demo of this on the demo machine in our front lobby.
summary.html:
We need to set the field of view of each camera for the OculusCamera, otherwise the view looks zoomed in.

values.description:
Recent ign-math [pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/91/fix-cppcheck-for-ignition-math/diff) changed some class constructors to be explicit, which result in a few implicit conversions in gazebo to fail. Gazebo currently doesn't compile against the latest ign-math `default` branch.

Note that we may also want to consider adding an overloaded ignition::math::Pose3<T> constructor that accepts a Vector3 position, and a Vector3 rotation. 

jenkins [gpu-none](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-none/155/) - clean
values.title: Fix compile errors due to ign-math explicit constructors

summary.raw:
Recent ign-math [pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/91/fix-cppcheck-for-ignition-math/diff) changed some class constructors to be explicit, which result in a few implicit conversions in gazebo to fail. Gazebo currently doesn't compile against the latest ign-math `default` branch.

Note that we may also want to consider adding an overloaded ignition::math::Pose3<T> constructor that accepts a Vector3 position, and a Vector3 rotation. 

jenkins [gpu-none](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-none/155/) - clean
summary.html:
Recent ign-math pull request changed some class constructors to be explicit, which result in a few implicit conversions in gazebo to fail. Gazebo currently doesn't compile against the latest ign-math default branch.

Note that we may also want to consider adding an overloaded ignition::math::Pose3<T> constructor that accepts a Vector3 position, and a Vector3 rotation.

jenkins gpu-none - clean

values.description:
This is a fix for a deadlock that Ian had some days ago.

Now, we don't lock any mutex when we execute the callbacks for updating the values of the items.
values.title: Introspection service - part6 (fix issue)

summary.raw:
This is a fix for a deadlock that Ian had some days ago.

Now, we don't lock any mutex when we execute the callbacks for updating the values of the items.
summary.html:
This is a fix for a deadlock that Ian had some days ago.

Now, we don't lock any mutex when we execute the callbacks for updating the values of the items.

values.reason: I'll create a more complete PR soon

values.description:
problem was that the update call, `QCoreApplication::processEvents()`, takes up to 0.1+ seconds on our jenkins homebrew slave machine so the loop is never able to finish before the test times out.

Also disabled FPS lower bound checks for slow machines.

jennkins [homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/164/testReport/)
values.title: Fix Mainwindow_TEST and TimeWidget_TEST for jenkins homebrew build

summary.raw:
problem was that the update call, `QCoreApplication::processEvents()`, takes up to 0.1+ seconds on our jenkins homebrew slave machine so the loop is never able to finish before the test times out.

Also disabled FPS lower bound checks for slow machines.

jennkins [homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/164/testReport/)
summary.html:
problem was that the update call, QCoreApplication::processEvents(), takes up to 0.1+ seconds on our jenkins homebrew slave machine so the loop is never able to finish before the test times out.

Also disabled FPS lower bound checks for slow machines.

jennkins homebrew

values.description:
* Add non-blocking versions of the functions in IntrospectionClient.
* Add some tests.
* Add a mutex to IntrospectionClient.
* Unlock the mutex in IntrospectionManager when we execute the callbacks for updating the values of the registered items.

~~~It requires [this pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-requests/112) from Ignition Transport.~~~
values.title: Introspection service - part6 (final tweaks)

summary.raw:
* Add non-blocking versions of the functions in IntrospectionClient.
* Add some tests.
* Add a mutex to IntrospectionClient.
* Unlock the mutex in IntrospectionManager when we execute the callbacks for updating the values of the registered items.

~~~It requires [this pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-requests/112) from Ignition Transport.~~~
summary.html:
• Add non-blocking versions of the functions in IntrospectionClient.
  • Add some tests.
  • Add a mutex to IntrospectionClient.
  • Unlock the mutex in IntrospectionManager when we execute the callbacks for updating the values of the registered items.

~It requires this pull request from Ignition Transport.~

values.description:
`OpenAL.NonDefaultDevice` test expected opening an invalid audio device to fail but it seems like  on osx `alcOpenDevice` never returns `NULL` no matter what device name string you give it, causing gazebo to think that the operation was successful.

I added an extra function to get a list of all available audio devices, and make sure that the requested device is in this list before attempting to open it.

jenkins:

[osx homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/197/) - ok

[abi](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-vivid-amd64/182/) - ok
values.title: Fix OpenAL test on osx -> gazebo7

summary.raw:
`OpenAL.NonDefaultDevice` test expected opening an invalid audio device to fail but it seems like  on osx `alcOpenDevice` never returns `NULL` no matter what device name string you give it, causing gazebo to think that the operation was successful.

I added an extra function to get a list of all available audio devices, and make sure that the requested device is in this list before attempting to open it.

jenkins:

[osx homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/197/) - ok

[abi](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-vivid-amd64/182/) - ok
summary.html:
OpenAL.NonDefaultDevice test expected opening an invalid audio device to fail but it seems like on osx alcOpenDevice never returns NULL no matter what device name string you give it, causing gazebo to think that the operation was successful.

I added an extra function to get a list of all available audio devices, and make sure that the requested device is in this list before attempting to open it.

jenkins:

osx homebrew - ok

abi - ok

values.description:
Problem - if you edit an existing model, e.g. `unit_box_0` and save it with the same name, gazebo currently will generate a different name for you, e.g. `unit_box_0_0`, which can be confusing. 

This PR allows you to save the model and keep its original name

jenkins:

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/199/testReport/) - ok

[abi](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20ABI%20jobs/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-vivid-amd64/186/)

values.description:
Resolves issue #892.

This pull request moves the ODE header files from `gazebo/deps/include/ode` to `gazebo/deps/include/gazebo/ode` so that we can use `#include <gazebo/ode/ode.h>`.
values.title: ODE include path

summary.raw:
Resolves issue #892.

This pull request moves the ODE header files from `gazebo/deps/include/ode` to `gazebo/deps/include/gazebo/ode` so that we can use `#include <gazebo/ode/ode.h>`.
summary.html:
Resolves issue #892.

This pull request moves the ODE header files from gazebo/deps/include/ode to gazebo/deps/include/gazebo/ode so that we can use #include <gazebo/ode/ode.h>.

values.description: The `UNIT_Timer_TEST` was disabled for OS X. I've enabled it and relaxed the expectations so that it will pass on OS X. There seems to be much more variance in timing on OS X than on Ubuntu.
values.title: Enable UNIT_Timer_TEST for OSX and relax the expectations slightly (fix #1626)

values.description:
UNIT_ModelAlign_TEST and INTEGRATION_world_population fail sporadically. 

I ran these tests in an infinite loop until they fail with gdb and both seemed to fail in `Connection::AsyncRead()`. My hypothesis is that we check if the socket is open in `AsyncRead()`, it's true, then the socket is closed (probably we're destructing objects) and then `boost::asio::async_read()` segfaults because the socket is null.

I haven't been able to reproduce the problem after this fix, so hopefully we solved the problem.

http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/987/
values.title: Mutex in Transport::Connection

values.description:
Editing physics parameters via gzclient was broken by pull request #2155 (issue #1876). In 1890927, I added a test to `UNIT_ModelListWidget_TEST` ([jenkins failure confirmed](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/191/testReport/junit/UNIT_ModelListWidget_TEST/xml/_empty_/)). The fix was very simple (473ac0e), restoring a line that had been removed in the prior pull request.

I also added some helper functions to `UNIT_ModelListWidget_TEST` (f592966, 3e9d1d5).
values.title: Fix editing physics parameters in gzclient, update test

summary.raw:

The fix was very simple (473ac0e), restoring a line that had been removed in the prior pull request.

I also added some helper functions to `UNIT_ModelListWidget_TEST` (f592966, 3e9d1d5).
summary.html:
Editing physics parameters via gzclient was broken by pull request #2155 (issue #1876). In 1890927, I added a test to UNIT_ModelListWidget_TEST (jenkins failure confirmed). The fix was very simple (473ac0e), restoring a line that had been removed in the prior pull request.

I also added some helper functions to UNIT_ModelListWidget_TEST (f592966, 3e9d1d5).

values.description:
Issue #1021

1. On my laptop, the tests would always fail because of the `QBENCHMARK` macro. Since it doesn't seem like we're using it in the [back-end](http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qtest-overview.html#creating-a-benchmark), it's probably ok to remove it. Removing it, the test passed 10 times in a row locally for me.

1. The test always failed on Jenkins between print statements `cam1 to cam6` and `cam6 to cam1`, indicating the crash comes from the `SetTopic` calls. So I refactored that a little bit.

The test now passes on [trusty gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/197/testReport/)

And [ABI](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-vivid-amd64/198/) is happy

[Diff without whitespace](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2194/fix-unit_imagesview_test/diff?w=1)
values.title: Fix UNIT_ImagesView_TEST

summary.raw:
Issue #1021

1. On my laptop, the tests would always fail because of the `QBENCHMARK` macro. Since it doesn't seem like we're using it in the [back-end](http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qtest-overview.html#creating-a-benchmark), it's probably ok to remove it. Removing it, the test passed 10 times in a row locally for me.

1. The test always failed on Jenkins between print statements `cam1 to cam6` and `cam6 to cam1`, indicating the crash comes from the `SetTopic` calls. So I refactored that a little bit.

The test now passes on [trusty gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/197/testReport/)

And [ABI](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-vivid-amd64/198/) is happy

[Diff without whitespace](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2194/fix-unit_imagesview_test/diff?w=1)
summary.html:
Issue #1021

  1. On my laptop, the tests would always fail because of the QBENCHMARK macro. Since it doesn't seem like we're using it in the back-end, it's probably ok to remove it. Removing it, the test passed 10 times in a row locally for me.

  2. The test always failed on Jenkins between print statements cam1 to cam6 and cam6 to cam1, indicating the crash comes from the SetTopic calls. So I refactored that a little bit.

The test now passes on trusty gpu

And ABI is happy

Diff without whitespace

values.description:
This PR adds the following features to the model database:

* Return the most recent model possible that can be understood by the SDF parser.
* Issues a warning if a model exists for a future version of the parser.
values.title: Better versioning in the model database

summary.raw:

* Return the most recent model possible that can be understood by the SDF parser.
* Issues a warning if a model exists for a future version of the parser.

  • Issues a warning if a model exists for a future version of the parser.

values.description:
* Start cleaning up unit test dependencies

* Remove gazebo_common requirement in AutoLogFixture, though logging will only work if if test/util.hh is included after gazebo/common/Console.hh

* Fix compilation and change ifdef to match the macro that is used

* Set TEST_DEPENDENCIES for transport unit tests

* link server_fixture with libgazebo, add server_fixture dependency to false unit tests in physics, rendering, and sensors; physics test are currently broken

* Use new fixure library name

* Missed one

* pimpl

* Get, ign-math

* std mutex

* Use AutoLogFixture for Battery_TEST instead of ServerFixture

* Revert change to test/util.hh, don't use AutoLogFixture in gazebo math tests

* Use AutoLogFixture in RenderingConversions_TEST instead of ServerFixture

* Set TEST_DEPENDENCIES for ode and bullet tests

* Separate AutoLogFixture tests from ServerFixture tests in physics, convert Inertial_TEST to AutoLogFixture

* Fix linking of RAMLibrary_TEST.cc

* Add TEST_LIBRARIES variable that will be linked, so that TEST_DEPENDENCIES is just a dependency

* Set TEST_LIBRARIES for INTEGRATION and REGRESSION tests

* Set TEST_DEPENDENCIES for UNIT_gz_TEST

* Don't link Noise and BulletTypes unit tests with gazebo_test_fixture

* Link tests with pthread on UNIX since gtest uses it

* Fix linking of examples test

* Add comment about gtest using pthread on UNIX

* Revert some changes to test/performance/CMakeLists.txt since pthread linking was added to GazeboTestUtils

* Redact use of TEST_DEPENDENCIES for now, save it for a later pull request

* Move cmake variable into macro parameter

* deprecated functions

* gazebo math

* removed duplicate include

* cppcheck

* Remove unneeded add_dependencies call, which causes cmake 3 warnings

* support saving and spawning model with same name

* changelog

* Close branch pimpl_model_creator

* style

* Close branch edit_spawn_same_name_7

* Close branch unit_test_dependencies

* Created new branch Add-hover-state-to-Palette-tabs

* added mouse hover over palette names
values.title: Add hover state to palette tabs

values.description:
* A new message is now published under the topic `/introspection/<manager_id>/items_update` when
the list of items of a manager has changed since the last update.

This will help with the refresh of the models on the GUI side.
values.title: [Plotting] Notify item updates via messages

summary.raw:
* A new message is now published under the topic `/introspection/<manager_id>/items_update` when
the list of items of a manager has changed since the last update.

This will help with the refresh of the models on the GUI side.
summary.html:
• A new message is now published under the topic /introspection/<manager_id>/items_update when the list of items of a manager has changed since the last update.

This will help with the refresh of the models on the GUI side.

values.description:
To the best of my knowledge, insertions are not being handled anywhere currently.

This pull request:

1. Handles insertions on `World::SetState`. This is needed for undo.

1. Revives world state tests and adds one for insertion

1. Makes `factorySDF` local instead of a member variable, since it is used in a single place.

Handling deletions will come afterwards.
values.title: Process insertions on World::SetState

summary.raw:
To the best of my knowledge, insertions are not being handled anywhere currently.

This pull request:

1. Handles insertions on `World::SetState`. This is needed for undo.

1. Revives world state tests and adds one for insertion

1. Makes `factorySDF` local instead of a member variable, since it is used in a single place.

Handling deletions will come afterwards.
summary.html:
To the best of my knowledge, insertions are not being handled anywhere currently.

This pull request:

  1. Handles insertions on World::SetState. This is needed for undo.

  2. Revives world state tests and adds one for insertion

  3. Makes factorySDF local instead of a member variable, since it is used in a single place.

Handling deletions will come afterwards.
